definitions.definition: To open the mouth widely and take a long, rather deep breath , often because one is tired or bored , and sometimes accompanied by pandiculation .
examples: I could see my students yawning , so I knew the lesson was boring them.

definitions.definition: To present a wide opening; gape .
examples: The canyon yawns as it has done for millions of years, and we stand looking, dumbstruck.
Death yawned before us, and I hit the brakes.

definitions.definition: To open the mouth, or to gape , through surprise or bewilderment .
To be eager; to desire to swallow anything; to express desire by yawning.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To open the mouth widely and take a long, rather deep breath , often because one is tired or bored , and sometimes accompanied by pandiculation .
secondary_definitions: To present a wide opening; gape .
( obsolete ) To open the mouth, or to gape , through surprise or bewilderment .
( obsolete ) To be eager; to desire to swallow anything; to express desire by yawning.
